description: Same rule as Aitken triangle (A011971) except a(0,0)=0, a(1,0)=1.
links: Reinhard Zumkeller, Rows n = 0..125 of triangle, flattened
prog: (Haskell)a046936 n k = a046936_tabl !! n !! ka046936_row n = a046936_tabl !! na046936_tabl = [0] : iterate (\row -> scanl (+) (last row) row) [1,1]-- _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Jan 01 2014(Python 3)from itertools import accumulatedef A046936(): # Compare function Gould_diag in A121207.    yield [0]    accu = [1, 1]    while True:        yield accu        accu = list(accumulate([accu[-1]] + accu))g = A046936()[next(g) for _ in range(9)] # _Peter Luschny_, Apr 25 2016
crossrefs: Borders give A040027. Reading across rows gives A007604.
author: _N. J. A. Sloane_, _R. K. Guy_
